thread.title: Bradford announce child's season ticket at 21p per game | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Bradford announce child's season ticket at 21p per game | Daily Mail Online

author: Amitai Winehouse For Mailonline
title: Bradford announce child's season ticket at 21p per game | Daily Mail Online
text: Huddersfield Town £179 While Bradford are currently in League One, they are in contention for promotion to the Championship through the play-offs, making the offer an even more incredible deal. The numbers are in huge contrast to the Premier League where season tickets can cost over £2000. Arsenal charged £2013 for their most expensive annual pass this season. And Tottenham Hotspur were not too far behind, offering an upper-end ticket for £1895. Bradford chief operating officer James Mason revealed he hopes other clubs will follow the Valley Parade club's example. Bradford have also frozen their adult season ticket price at £149 for yet another season He said: 'Freezing the prices is a huge statement to the rest of the football world that the game should be affordable for all. 'Despite the temptation to charge higher prices in higher leagues, we believe in growing our fan base by inspiring families to watch together. I'm proud to be a Bradfordian working for a club that really values its supporters. 'We have so much still to play for this season and the exciting news is that no matter what, supporters will be watching live football at the Northern Commercials Stadium next season whether in League One or the Championship for the same price. For an adult that's less that £6.50 per game!' It comes in contrast to top flight football - Arsenal's most expensive price is £2013 for a season RELATED ARTICLES
